common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch Failure
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch, often stuck at "Ensuring Core Dependencies." This primarily affected Windows users after version 11.1.1 due to stricter hardware requirements. Issue resolved in version 11.1.2.  MacOS users experienced similar issues, resolved in later updates. Providing logs aided diagnosis.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** User experiences difficulty with PiecesOS launch.

**Key points raised:**

* User created an issue regarding PiecesOS not launching.
* User provided details about the issue.
* Pieces support bot posted an automatic response with:
    * Acknowledgement and appreciation for creating the issue.
    * Estimated response time of 24 hours.
    * Links to related issues and helpful resources.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS failing to launch for the user.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Triaged the issue and assigned it to the relevant team member.
* Suggested reviewing related issues and helpful resources.
* Promised a follow-up within 24 hours.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue created and awaiting response from the Pieces team.

**Note:** This summary focuses only on the information provided in the snippet. No further details are available.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

- DevWizard24 reported an issue with Pieces OS not launching.
- GetReal444 confirmed the same issue and suggested providing logs.

**Problems identified:**

- Hardware requirements were stricter than initially thought in Pieces OS version 11.1.1.
- This caused the application to not launch for some users.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- Mark-at-pieces requested logs from users to diagnose the issue.
- tsavo-at-pieces confirmed the issue and mentioned a release to mitigate it.
- A patch (11.1.2) was released to resolve the problem.

**Current status/outcome:**

- The issue was resolved with the release of Pieces OS 11.1.2.
- Mark-at-pieces closed the issue.

**Additional notes:**

- DevWizard24 confirmed the issue was resolved after updating to version 11.1.2.
- The issue was also related to another reported issue (#625).

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

**Key points raised:**

* **Problem:** Many users, including the original poster, `rogierlegit`, experienced PiecesOS failing to start up properly. 
* **Symptoms:** PiecesOS would get stuck in the "dependencies scenario" tab, wouldn't appear in the tray, or would disappear after a few seconds. 
* **Possible causes:**
    * **Major migration in 11.1.0:** This caused issues for some users, particularly those with a lot of data. 
    * **AppInstaller issues:** Early versions of the installer had bugs. 
    * **Self-signed certificate issues:** Some users experienced handshake errors. 
    * **OneDrive conflict:** A database conflict with OneDrive caused issues for some users. 
    * **MacOS issues:** The problem was particularly prevalent on MacOS. 
    * **Processor age:** Some older processors had issues with the app. 
* **Solutions proposed:**
    * **Wait for PiecesOS to finish migrating:** This could take a while, especially for users with a lot of data. 
    * **Use the appInstaller build:** This fixed issues for some users. 
    * **Provide user logs:** This helped the PiecesOS team diagnose the problem. 
    * **Restart the app:** This fixed the issue for some users. 
    * **Update to 11.1.1:** This fixed the issue for the majority of users. 
    * **Remove the com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive:** This fixed the issue for users with OneDrive conflicts. 
    * **Update to 11.1.2:** This fixed the issue for some users, especially on MacOS. 

**Problems identified:**

* **AppInstaller bugs:** Early versions of the AppInstaller caused issues for some users. 
* **Major migration issues:** The 11.1.0 migration caused issues for many users, particularly those with a lot of data.
* **Self-signed certificate issues:** Some users experienced handshake errors. 
* **OneDrive conflict:** A database conflict with OneDrive caused issues for some users. 
* **MacOS issues:** The problem was particularly prevalent on MacOS. 
* **Processor age:** Some older processors had issues with the app. 

**Solutions implemented:**

* **AppInstaller fix:** The PiecesOS team fixed the bugs in the AppInstaller. 
* **11.1.1 update:** This update fixed the majority of the issues caused by the 11.1.0 migration. 
* **11.1.2 update:** This update fixed the remaining issues, especially on MacOS. 
* **OneDrive fix:** The PiecesOS team shipped a patch to prevent the OneDrive conflict from happening again. 

**Current status:**

* The issue has been resolved for most users. 
* The PiecesOS team is working on a patch to prevent the "dependencies scenario" tab from hanging altogether in the future. 
* Users are encouraged to update to the latest version of PiecesOS (currently 3.3.8). 

**Outcome:**

* The PiecesOS team was able to identify and fix the various issues causing the problem.
* The app is now working properly for most users.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to AVX2 requirement
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from a new dependency on AVX2 instruction set support in CPUs. The Pieces team addressed the issue by releasing a patch (version 11.1.2) that removed the AVX2 requirement, resolving the launch problem for affected users.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue #625

**Key points raised:**

* User @gonzososa opened an issue reporting inability to launch PiecesOS on Mac due to an error.
* @gonzososa provided a detailed error message and system information.

**Problems identified:**

* The user's CPU (Intel Core i5-3210M) lacked AVX2 support, which was required by a new vector library in PiecesOS.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and worked on a fix in their new vector library.
* They released version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS with the fix.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User @gonzososa confirmed that the fix in version 11.1.2 resolved the issue and PiecesOS is working now.
* The issue is considered resolved and closed. 

**Additional notes:**

* The issue was related to another issue discussing vector library compatibility on older CPUs.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* User (@GetReal444) experiencing issue booting up PiecesOS.
* Additional users reporting similar issues (#620, #624, #625).
* Issue related to AVX2 hardware requirement for the database service.

**Problems identified:**

* Users with processors lacking AVX2 support unable to run PiecesOS.
* Widespread impact on user base.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Investigate and resolve database service dependency on AVX2.
* Release patch within 24-48 hours (2025-02-11).
* Update PiecesOS to version 11.1.2 (2025-02-14).

**Current status/outcome:**

* Patch released and issue resolved as of 2025-02-15.
* User (@GetReal444) confirms successful operation after updating to 11.1.2.

**Additional notes:**

* Issue initially misdiagnosed as individual hardware problem (#620).
* Pieces team actively addressed issue and provided timely updates.
* User acknowledged and appreciated the team's responsiveness.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to database errors
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch on Ubuntu and Windows, encountering 'DatabaseException' or issues with core dependencies. The errors were linked to AVX2 hardware requirements for the database service. Solutions included updating to the latest PiecesOS version (11.1.2) which contained a patch addressing the AVX2 dependency.

* Users are encouraged to update to the latest version of PiecesOS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been closed.

**Next Steps:**

* The user should update to the latest version of PiecesOS.
* If the issue persists, the user should reopen the issue.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot/Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to boot or launch on macOS and Windows. On macOS, this was often due to installing the Intel version on ARM Macs. Reinstalling from the correct link resolved it. On Windows, stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1 caused launch failures, addressed in the 11.1.2 patch.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points:** * The author, mark-at-pieces, reported an issue on 2025-02-17T13:17:05+00:00. * The issue has since been resolved. **Problems Identified:** * The specific problem discussed in the conversation is not explicitly stated. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * No solutions are discussed in the conversation. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is marked as resolved. **Additional Notes:** * Due to the limited information available, it is not possible to provide a more detailed summary of the conversation.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Network Connectivity and Download Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS connecting to cloud services and downloading local LLMs. This could be due to network configurations, firewall blocking requests, or issues with specific PiecesOS versions. Proposed solutions include checking network settings, providing logs for debugging, and upgrading to the latest PiecesOS version.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Issue Summary for Pieces Support Issue #[issueNumber]

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @rohanrathi99 is experiencing issues when making requests to Pieces cloud services and with local models.
* First image in the report shows the error message encountered.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration may be blocking PiecesOS outgoing requests.
* Logs for 'com.pieces.os' and 'com.pieces.pfd' are required for troubleshooting.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Requesting user to provide relevant logs for investigation.
* Offering real-time debugging support via [provided calendar link](https://calendar.app.google/rADF8GaGyX8Ju98L9).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Awaiting user response with required logs or scheduling a real-time debugging session.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Key Points and Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue Title:** User reports "Connection closed before full header was received" error for local LLM download (2025-01-18)

**Key Points:**

* User reports an error while downloading local LLM: "Connection closed before full header was received."
* Pieces Support Bot provides resources and related issues for reference.
* @mark-at-pieces asks for support logs and tries to reproduce the error.
* Problem might have been fixed in version 11.1.2.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Provide support logs for debugging.
* Check if the error occurs with all local LLM downloads.
* Upgrade to version 11.1.2, which might include a fix for the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unclear if the problem persists after version 11.1.2 upgrade.
* User (@AmanSingh766) hasn't responded to confirm resolution or if the issue remains open.

**Overall:**

* The issue seems related to a network connection error while downloading local LLMs.
* The proposed solutions involve providing logs and verifying if the problem persists.
* It's recommended that the user follow up with @mark-at-pieces to confirm resolution or reopen the issue if the problem continues.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving PiecesOS launch failures:** The most frequent and active support tickets revolve around PiecesOS failing to launch, particularly after the 11.1.1 update. Focus on addressing the root causes, such as AVX2 dependency and database errors, to prevent similar issues in future releases.

**Improve communication about hardware/software requirements:** Clearly communicate any changes in hardware or software requirements to users before they upgrade to avoid compatibility issues. Provide detailed system requirements documentation and highlight potential compatibility issues with older hardware.

**Develop a comprehensive troubleshooting guide for launch failures:** Create a dedicated section in the support documentation that specifically addresses PiecesOS launch failures. Include step-by-step instructions for common solutions, such as checking system requirements, updating to the latest version, and providing logs for debugging.

**Enhance error messaging and logging:** Improve error messages to provide more specific information about the cause of the launch failure. Encourage users to submit detailed logs when reporting issues to aid in faster diagnosis and resolution.

**Consider a more robust beta testing program:** Implement a more comprehensive beta testing program to identify and address potential issues before releasing new versions to the public. This will help minimize the impact of bugs and compatibility problems on users.
